meanings.definition: To press something firmly between two surfaces.
meanings.sent1: She was squeezing the sponge to remove the water.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys squeezing the toothpaste tube to get every last bit out.
meanings.sent3: The chef was squeezing the lemon like it owed him money.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like someone was squeezing it tightly.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler was squeezing his opponent in a tight hold.

meanings.definition: To extract or obtain something by applying pressure.
meanings.sent1: He was squeezing the information out of the suspect.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was squeezing the milk from the cow's udder.
meanings.sent3: The detective was squeezing the truth out of the witness.
meanings.sent4: The journalist was squeezing every detail from the interviewee.
meanings.sent5: The student was squeezing the last drops of juice from the orange.

meanings.definition: To compress or constrict something by applying pressure.
meanings.sent1: The snake was squeezing its prey tightly in its coils.
meanings.sent2: She was squeezing the clay to make a small sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The python was squeezing the tree trunk like a giant hug.
meanings.sent4: The vice was squeezing the metal rod until it bent.
meanings.sent5: The hug felt like someone was squeezing all the air out of her lungs.
